content.description: This route goes up the right side of the tower between Easter Island and Thumbelina, left of a big left facing dihedral.  Look for a thin hand to a zig-zag offwidth.  The first pitch goes up a hand to an offwidth crack, over a bulge with cool liebacks using two cracks to a bolted belay. The second pitch goes up a short, thin crack to easier climbing to another bolted belay.  Both pitches are 5.10.  The last pitch goes past a bolt above the belay through some hard, bouldery 5.11 moves to a subsidary summit and another bolt.  Lean across the gap between this summit and the true summit to a crack, then left to the belay and the top.  Don't forget to sign the summit register.  One single rap down this pitch, then it is possible to make a double rope rap with 200 foot ropes to the ground.
content.protection: Cams of all sizes.  It is easy to string the first two pitches together.  I used up to a #4 Camalot on the first pitch, and a #3.5 Camalot is also helpful.  Also bring some small cams and at least doubles of hand sized pieces.  Bring two #2 and a #3 Camalots for the last pitch an a couple quickdraws.
